reviews.text: I fell down at this spot when it was not raining but it was wet. Maybe nothing to do with Sheng Siong but I hope you take note because many elderly visit your store. I'm younger. I have also seen another young guy slip walking past, but it was raining.

This Sheng Siong is very spacious with lots of room along the aisles to move around. For such a large branch, it is surprising that the selection of fruits and vegetables are rather limited. Good selection of live and frozen seafood though. The non-perishables such as alcohol and canned food have a wide variety too.

When this Sheng Siong outlet just opened, the produce were fresh and good, especially the green vegetables and fruits such as apples and oranges.  After a few months, the outlet no longer clear the rotting fruits/vegetables as diligently.  Rotting vegs and fruits are being spotted in various places.  The non-produce items are alright.

Had great service from Mr Ong, who wears a red sheng shiong t shirt. Didn't have a chance to catch his name. Needed 6 cartons of drinks and ice bags. He took a trolley and started stacking the drinks and even offloaded it at my car. Very thankful for him because I was just recovering from a flu and feeling very weak. But I really needed to get the order.

New supermarket just opened recently, quite clean, and convenient,so I don’t have to walk all the way to Commonwealth MRT to buy at another Shengsiong. Let’s hope this keeps up as not all resident moved in yet.
